values.name: Microsoft Explore
values.description: 12-week internship program designed for freshmen and sophomores, work in small groups of other Explore interns, get to explore different roles at Microsoft regarding software development

values.name: Google Engineering Practicum
values.description: 12-week internship program designed for freshmen and sophomores, work on a project with other interns and full-time Googlers

values.name: Facebook University for Engineering
values.description: 8-week program focusing on mobile development for freshmen, with first 3 weeks as training, 5 weeks as hands-on project time

values.name: Amazon Future Engineer Internship
values.description: 9-week program focusing on software development for freshmen and sophomores, working alongside a technical mentor and a manager

values.name: Twitter Academy Internship
values.description: 12-week internship for freshmen, working in small teams alongside full-time Tweeps

values.name: Google Summer of Code
values.description: Work alongside a mentor on an open-source project with a stipend

values.name: Code2040
values.description: Internship program to place students from underrepresented minorities, specifically focused on Black and Latinx students, in startups and companies for the summer

values.name: KPCB Fellowship
values.description: Work at a KPCB portfolio startup for 3 months as a Design, Engineering or Product fellow. KPCB is a venture capital firm that has invested in companies like Airbnb, Pinterest, Indiegogo, and Uber.

values.name: HackNY Fellowship
values.description: Work at a startup or technology-based company in the NYC area for 3 months, participate in activities as part of the fellows community. Companies represented include MongoDB, Buzzfeed, Tumblr, Mashable, etc.

values.name: Women Techmakers Scholars Program
values.description: In honor of Dr. Anita Borg, who believed that technology affects all aspects of our economic, political, social and personal lives, Google awards this scholarship of $10,000 to female undergraduates based on the strength of each candidate’s academic background and demonstrated leadership.

values.name: Microsoft Diversity Scholarship
values.description: Recipients receive paid registration to one of the following diversity conferences: Grace Hopper Celebration of Women in Computing, National Society of Black Engineers Conference, Society of Hispanic Professional Engineers Conference, Tapia Conference

values.name: NCWIT Aspirations in Computing
values.description: The NCWIT Collegiate Award honors the outstanding computing accomplishments of undergraduate and graduate women. Conferred annually, the award recognizes technical contributions to projects that demonstrate a high level of innovation and potential impact.

values.name: Point Foundation Scholarship
values.description: Point Foundation (Point) is the nation’s largest higher education scholarship-granting organization for lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and queer (LGBTQ) students. Point’s multifaceted support of its scholarship recipients (“scholars”) extends far beyond direct financial contribution toward the cost of their education. Each scholar is paired with a mentor and participates in leadership development programs and events.

values.name: Palantir Scholarship for Women in Technology
values.description: 10 finalists awarded grants and invited to Palantir HQ for workshops, select participants are selected for an internship

values.name: Buildium Women in Technology Scholarship
values.description: Awards one $2,500 scholarship each semester to a woman who can explain which female leader most inspires them to pursue their dreams, and why.

values.name: Grace Hopper Scholarship from Anita Borg Institute
values.description: Grace Hopper Conference is the largest conference celebrating women in computing. The Anita Borg institute, which organizes the conference, provides scholarships every year to those who apply.

values.name: Google Travel Grants
values.description: Funding provided for select conferences from Google

values.name: Facebook Developer Conference
values.description: 2-day conference in San Jose, CA

values.name: AWS Global Summit
values.description: Amazon AWS summits held in multiple cities throughout the year

values.name: Microsoft Ignite Conference
values.description: Microsoft developer conference held in multiple cities

values.name: WWDC Scholarships
values.description: Apply for a scholarship to Apple's annual developer conference

values.name: GitHub Universe
values.description: Open source tech conference in San Francisco, CA

values.name: Out for Undergrad
values.description: A 2-day conference for any student who is interested in Technology, Marketing, Business or Engineering, application only, all expenses paid except for an acceptance fee if accepted

values.name: Lesbians Who Tech
values.description: Apply for a scholarship to attend the LWT Summit in San Francisco

values.name: Facebook Groups
values.description: Ladies Storm Hackathons, Tech Ladies, NCWIT Aspirations in Computing, Global Tech Women, Hackathon Hackers (including subcommunities and special interest groups)

values.name: Slack Channels
values.description: LGBTQ in Tech (lgbt.slack.com), Frontend Developers (frontenddevelopers.slack.com), Slashrocket (slashrocket.io)

values.name: Tracy Chou
values.description: Former software engineer at Pinterest and Quora, involved with Project Include, a non-profit that works to help companies improve their employee diversity and inclusion, jumpstarted the movement to encourage companies to release their diversity numbers

values.name: Cassidy Williams
values.description: Software Engineer at L4Digital, moderator for HH, heavily involved in women in tech movements

values.name: Laura Weidman Powers
values.description: Co-Founder, Code2040

values.name: Kimberly Bryant
values.description: Founder, BlackGirlsCode

values.name: Megan Smith
values.description: Former CTO of the United States and former Google Engineer

values.name: Anil Dash
values.description: CEO of Fog Creek Software, prolific blogger of ethics and technology

values.name: Parisa Tabriz
values.description: Head of Security, Google Chrome and UIUC Alum

values.name: Amy Chen
values.description: Founder, Ladies Storm Hackathons on Facebook

values.name: Emily Chang
values.description: Journalist and host of Bloomberg Technology, a daily show focused on technology and the future of business
